sen.j: 歌合（うたあわせ）とは、歌人を左右二組にわけて行う遊び。
sen.e: Uta-awase is a contest in which two teams of poets divided into the right and the left sides.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Uta-awase is a contest in which two teams of poets divided into the right and the left sides.
Uta-awase is a contest in which two teams of poets divided into the right and the left sides.

sen.j: 歌人の詠んだ歌を一番ごとに比べて優劣を争う。
sen.e: Poets in each team create poems, which are compared every match and see whose work is better.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Poets in each team create poems, which are compared every match and see whose work is better.
Poets in each team create poems, which are compared every match and see whose work is better.

sen.j: 審判役を判者（はんじゃ）、判定の詞（ことば）を判詞（はんじ）という。
sen.e: A judge is called Hanja and a statement made by Hanja Hanji.
A judge is called Hanja and his statement is called Hanji.
A judge is called Hanja and his statement is called Hanji.

sen.j: この判詞はだんだんと文学的な性格を帯びるようになり、歌論へとつながっていった。
sen.e: This Hanji gradually started to assume literary values and eventually established itself as poetry criticism.
This Hanji gradually started to assume literary values and eventually established itself as poetry criticism.
This Hanji gradually started to assume literary values and eventually established itself as poetry criticism.

sen.j: 役割は判者の他に方人（かたうど；歌を提出する者）、念人（おもいびと；自陣の歌を褒め、弁護する役）とがある。
sen.e: Besides Hanja, the uta-awase contest involves Kataudo (a person who submits a poem), and Omoibito (a role to praise and defend his/her own team member's poems).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Besides Hanja, the uta-awase contest involves Kataudo (a person who submits a poem), and Omoibito (a role to praise and defend his/her own team member's poems).
Besides Hanja, the uta-awase contest involves Kataudo (a person who submits a poem), and Omoibito (a role to praise and defend his/her own team member's poems).

sen.j: 左右両陣の念人による一種のディベートによって判者の判定を導くものである。
sen.e: Omoibitos in the right and the left sides engage in a kind of debate, on which is based Hanja's judgment.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Omoibitos in the right and the left sides engage in a kind of debate, on which is based Hanja's judgment.
Omoibitos in the right and the left sides engage in a kind of debate, on which is based Hanja's judgment.

sen.j: 平安時代に始まった。
sen.e: Uta-awase dates back to the Heian Era. The oldest uta-awase recorded in a document is the one at the residence of Zai-Mimbukyo held in 885.
Uta-awase dates back to the Heian period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処Eraをperiodに訂正しました。
sen.e: Uta-awase dates back to the Heian period.

sen.j: 記録にあるものとしては仁和元年（885年）の在民部卿家歌合が最古のものとされる。
sen.e: The oldest uta-awase recorded in a document is the Zaiminbukyo-ke Uta-awase (Uta-awase held at Minbusho, the Ministry of Civil Affairs, during ARIWARA no Yukihira's service as the administrator) held in 885.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処用語集より、在民部卿家歌合→Zaiminbukyo-ke Uta-awase (Uta-awase held at Minbusho, the Ministry of Civil Affairs, during ARIWARA no Yukihira's service as the administrator)に訂正しました。
sen.e: The oldest uta-awase recorded in a document is the Zaiminbukyo-ke Uta-awase (Uta-awase held at Minbusho, the Ministry of Civil Affairs, during ARIWARA no Yukihira's service as the administrator) held in 885.

sen.j: 他に天徳 (日本)4年（960年）の天徳内裏歌合、建久3年（1192年）の六百番歌合、建仁元年（1201年）の千五百番歌合などが名高い。
sen.e: Other well-known uta-awase contests include Tentoku-dairi Uta-awase in 960, Roppyakuban Uta-awase in 1192 and Sengohyakuban Uta-awase in 1201.
Other well-known uta-awase contests include Tentoku-dairi Uta-awase in 960, Roppyakuban Uta-awase in 1192 and Sengohyakuban Uta-awase in 1201.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: Other well-known uta-awase contests include Tentoku-dairi Uta-awase in 960, Roppyakuban Uta-awase in 1192 and Sengohyakuban Uta-awase in 1201.

sen.j: 基本的に「遊び」であるが、平安期には歌の優劣が出世にもかかわる重大事であったため今日行われるような気軽なものではない。
sen.e: Uta-awase is basically a "game," but in the Heian Era, a talent for poetry was an important factor for promotion and it was not just an entertainment as it is today.
Uta-awase is basically a 'game,' but in the Heian period, a talent for poetry was an important factor for promotion and it was not just an entertainment as it is today.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。Eraをperiodに訂正しました。
sen.e: Uta-awase is basically a 'game,' but in the Heian period, a talent for poetry was an important factor for promotion and it was not just an entertainment as it is today.

sen.j: また、時代が下るにつれて文学性が高くなり、前述のように「判詞」が文学論・歌論としての位置づけを持つようになった。
sen.e: Over generations, its literary feature became stronger and, as mentioned above, "Hanji" came to establish itself as literary/poetry criticism.
Over generations, its literary feature became stronger and, as mentioned above, 'Hanji' came to establish itself as literary/poetry criticism.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。
sen.e: Over generations, its literary feature became stronger and, as mentioned above, 'Hanji' came to establish itself as literary/poetry criticism.

sen.j: 近代短歌以後、「遊び」の要素が嫌われて一旦廃れた。
sen.e: In the modern era when the tanka (a form of Japanese poetry, consisting of five lines of 5, 7, 5, 7 and 7 syllables), became dominant, the uta-awase contest, as its entertaining element was shunned, went out of fashion and became obsolete.
sen.cmt: 「短歌」はそのままローマ字で表記し、原文にはないが、説明を追加した。一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the modern era when the tanka (a form of Japanese poetry, consisting of five lines of 5, 7, 5, 7 and 7 syllables) became dominant, the uta-awase contest went out of fashion and became obsolete because its entertaining element was shunned,.
sen.cmt: 不要なコンマ削除しました。文章訂正しました。
sen.e: In the modern era when the tanka (a form of Japanese poetry, consisting of five lines of 5, 7, 5, 7 and 7 syllables) became dominant, the uta-awase contest went out of fashion and became obsolete because its entertaining element was shunned,.

sen.j: だが、1980年代ころからまた行われるようになってきている。
sen.e: Since around 1980s, though, uta-awase contests resumed to be held regularly.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Since around 1980s, though, uta-awase contests resumed to be held regularly.
Since around 1980s, though, uta-awase contests resumed to be held regularly.

sen.j: 念人は歌をどれだけ高く評価し、その良さを引き出すことができるか、という読みの力を試される。
sen.e: The competency of Omoibito is assessed based on his/her interpretation skills: how highly s/he evaluates a poem and recognizes its true value.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処念人に性別の規制はなかったという前提で、"s/he"の表記にしています。
sen.e: The competency of Omoibito is assessed based on his/her interpretation skills: how highly he/she evaluates a poem and recognizes its true value.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。he/sheに訂正しました。
sen.e: The competency of Omoibito is assessed based on his/her interpretation skills: how highly he/she evaluates a poem and recognizes its true value.

sen.j: また方人はその掘り下げに耐える深みのある歌を作る力を試されることになる。
sen.e: A challenge for a kataudo, then, is to create a poem that allows such skillful interpretations.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: A challenge for a kataudo, then, is to create a poem that allows such skillful interpretations.
A challenge for a kataudo, then, is to create a poem that allows such skillful interpretations.

sen.j: これは近代以降の文学としての短歌にとっても有用なことであると考えられるようになったためである。
sen.e: The revival of uta-awase contests is explained by these functions of omoibito and kataudo that were considered to be useful for tanka as it was establishing itself as literature in and after the modern era.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The revival of uta-awase contests is explained by these functions of omoibito and kataudo that were considered to be useful for tanka as it was establishing itself as literature in and after the modern era.

The revival of uta-awase contests is explained by these functions of omoibito and kataudo that were considered to be useful for tanka as it was establishing itself as literature in and after the modern era.

sen.j: 用語
sen.e: Terms
Terms
Terms

sen.j: 方人（かたうど）
sen.e: Kataudo
Kataudo
Kataudo

sen.j: 歌合の歌を提出する者。
sen.e: A kataudo is a person who submits a poem in the uta-awase contest or a poet.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処最初の二行を一文にまとめました。
sen.e: A kataudo is a person who submits a poem in the uta-awase contest or a poet.
A kataudo is a person who submits a poem in the uta-awase contest.
sen.cmt: 「。」がついているので2文に分けました。

sen.j: 作者。
sen.e: A poet.
sen.cmt: 「。」がついているので2文に分けました。

sen.j: 平安期には身分の低い者に詠ませることがある。
sen.e: During the Heian Era, occasionally those from the lower class were allowed to create poems.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: During the Heian period, occasionally those from the lower class were allowed to create poems.
During the Heian period, occasionally those from the lower class were allowed to create poems.

sen.j: その場合には歌合には方人は出席しなかった。
sen.e: In such occasions, kataudos did not attend the uta-awase contests.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In such occasions, kataudos did not attend the uta-awase contests.
In such occasions, kataudos did not attend the uta-awase contests.

sen.j: 今日では念人と同一である場合がほとんどである。
sen.e: Today in most cases, the same person plays both roles of kataudo and omoibito.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Today in most cases, the same person plays both roles of kataudo and omoibito.
Today in most cases, the same person plays both roles of kataudo and omoibito.

sen.j: 念人（おもいびと）
sen.e: Omoibito
Omoibito
Omoibito

sen.j: 自陣の歌を褒め、敵陣の歌の欠点を指摘して議論を有利に導く。
sen.e: An omoibito praises poems submitted by his/her own team and points out defects in the opponent's works, in order to keep the edge in debates.
An omoibito praises poems submitted by his/her own team and points out defects in the opponent's works, in order to keep the edge in debates.
An omoibito praises poems submitted by his/her own team and points out defects in the opponent's works, in order to keep the edge in debates.

sen.j: 方人と同一視されることも多い。
sen.e: Omoibitos are often identified with kataudo.
Omoibitos are often identified with kataudo.
Omoibitos are often identified with kataudo.

sen.j: 複数が左右に別れて評定（ひょうじょう；ディベート）を行う。
sen.e: More than one omoibitos are divided into two teams, in the right and the left, and engage in a debate.
More than one omoibitos are divided into two teams, in the right and the left, and engage in a debate.
More than one omoibitos are divided into two teams, in the right and the left, and engage in a debate.

sen.j: 判者（はんじゃ）
sen.e: Hanja
Hanja
Hanja

sen.j: 左右の歌の優劣を判定して勝敗を決める。
sen.e: A hanja determines which poems are better, the right or the left, and decides the winner and the loser.
A hanja determines which poems are better, the right or the left, and decides the winner and the loser.
A hanja determines which poems are better, the right or the left, and decides the winner and the loser.

sen.j: 持（じ；引き分け）とする場合もある。
sen.e: A hanja can also draw a match, which is called "Ji."
A hanja can also draw a match, which is called "Ji."
A hanja can also draw a match, which is called "Ji."

sen.j: 主に歌壇の重鎮が務める。
sen.e: Usually a heavyweight in the society of poets assumes the role of hanja.
Usually a heavyweight in the society of poets assumes the role of hanja.
Usually a heavyweight in the society of poets assumes the role of hanja.

sen.j: 新古今時代以降、衆議判と言って、参加者によって優劣が判定されることも多くなった。
sen.e: During and after the Shinkokin Period (transitional period of Japanese literature between the Heian and the Kamakura Periods), a style of judgment called shugihan became common, in which participants are all involved in evaluating poems.

During and after the Shinkokin period (transitional period of Japanese literature between the Heian and the Kamakura periods), a style of judgment called shugihan became common, in which participants are all involved in evaluating poems.
sen.cmt: period小文字に訂正しました。
sen.e: During and after the Shinkokin period (transitional period of Japanese literature between the Heian and the Kamakura periods), a style of judgment called shugihan became common, in which participants are all involved in evaluating poems.

sen.j: 講師（こうじ）
sen.e: Koji
Koji
Koji

sen.j: 歌合の場で歌を読み上げる役。
sen.e: A koji is a person who reads aloud poems at the uta-awase contests.
A koji is a person who reads aloud poems at the uta-awase contests.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: A koji is a person who reads aloud poems at the uta-awase contests.

sen.j: 読み上げることを披講（ひこう）という。
sen.e: Reading aloud the poem at the uta-awase is called hiko.
Reading aloud the poem at the uta-awase is called "hiko."
sen.cmt: 用語を読みやすくするため" "に入れました。
sen.e: Reading aloud the poem at the uta-awase is called "hiko."

sen.j: 披講は左方を先に行う。
sen.e: Hiko starts with the left, or the poem from the left group will be read first.
Hiko starts with the left, or the poem from the left group will be read first.
Hiko starts with the left, or the poem from the left group will be read first.

sen.j: 平安時代は左右それぞれにいたが、のちに一人となった。
sen.e: During the Heian Period, both right and left sides had their own kojis but in the later period, one koji was in charge for the two teams.
During the Heian period, both right and left sides had their own kojis but in the later period, one koji was in charge for the two teams.
sen.cmt: period小文字に訂正しました。
sen.e: During the Heian period, both right and left sides had their own kojis but in the later period, one koji was in charge for the two teams.

sen.j: 現代では特に置かないことが多い。
sen.e: In the modern times, it is common that a koji is not particularly assigned.
In the modern times, it is common that a koji is not particularly assigned.
In the modern times, it is common that a koji is not particularly assigned.

sen.j: 判詞（はんじ）
sen.e: Hanji
Hanji
Hanji

sen.j: 判者が述べる判定の理由。
sen.e: Hanji means reasons for judgment stated by a hanja.
Hanji means reasons for judgment stated by a hanja.
Hanji means reasons for judgment stated by a hanja.

sen.j: 題（だい）
sen.e: Dai, or a theme
Dai, or a theme
Dai, or a theme

sen.j: 優劣の判断がつくように歌合の歌は現代においても題詠である。
sen.e: As criteria in evaluating poems, themes are given even in the modern era for poems to be created at the uta-awase contests.
As criteria in evaluating poems, themes are given even in the modern era for poems to be created at the uta-awase contests.
As criteria in evaluating poems, themes are given even in the modern era for poems to be created at the uta-awase contests.

sen.j: 主な歌合
sen.e: Major uta-awase contests
Major uta-awase contests
Major uta-awase contests

sen.j: ＜＞内は主催者
sen.e: Hosts are indicated in < >.
Hosts are indicated in ().
Hosts are indicated in ().

sen.j: 在民部卿家歌合 ： 仁和元年（885年）頃（記録に残る最古の歌合）＜在原行平＞
sen.e: Zai-Mimbukyoke Uta-awase: held in around 885; (the oldest uta-awase recorded in the document) <ARIWARA no Yukihira>
Zaiminbukyo-ke Uta-awase: Held in around 885; the oldest uta-awase recorded in the document (ARIWARA no Yukihira)
sen.cmt: Zaiminbukyo-ke Uta-awaseに訂正しました。不要なスペースを削除しました。;の後ろの括弧削除しました。:のあとを大文字にしました。
sen.e: Zaiminbukyo-ke Uta-awase: Held in around 885; the oldest uta-awase recorded in the document (ARIWARA no Yukihira)

sen.j: 寛平御時后宮歌合 ： 寛平元年（889年）
sen.e: Kanpyono Ontoki Kisainomiya Uta-awase: held in 889
Kanpyono Ontoki Kisainomiya Uta-awase: Held in 889
sen.cmt: :のあとを大文字にしました。

sen.j: 亭子院歌合 ： 延喜13年（913年）
sen.e: Teiji-in no Uta-awase: held in 913
Teijiｘin no Uta-awase: Held in 913
sen.cmt: ハイフン削除しました。:のあとを大文字にしました。
sen.e: Teijiｘin no Uta-awase: Held in 913

sen.j: 天徳内裏歌合 ： 天徳 (日本)4年（960年）＜村上天皇＞
sen.e: Tentoku Dairi Uta-awase: held in 960 <Emperor Murakami>
Tentoku Dairi Uta-awase: Held in 960 (Emperor Murakami)
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。:のあとを大文字にしました。<>を()に訂正しました。

sen.j: 寛和二年内裏歌合 ： 寛和2年（986年）＜花山天皇＞
sen.e: Kanna Ninen Dairi Uta-awase: held in 986 <Emperor Hanayama>
Kanna Ninen Dairi Uta-awase: Held in 986 (Emperor Hanayama)

sen.e: Kanna Ninen Dairi Uta-awase: Held in 986 (Emperor Hanayama)

sen.j: 六百番歌合 ： 建久3年（1192年）＜九条良経＞
sen.e: Roppyakuban Uta-awase: held in 1192 <Yoshitsune KUJO>
Roppyakuban Uta-awase: Held in 1192 (Yoshitsune KUJO)
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。:のあとを大文字にしました。<>を()に訂正しました。
sen.e: Roppyakuban Uta-awase: Held in 1192 (Yoshitsune KUJO)

sen.j: 千五百番歌合 ： 建仁元年（1201年）頃＜後鳥羽天皇＞
sen.e: Sengohyakuban Uta-awase: held in 1201 <Emperor Gotoba>
Sengohyakuban Uta-awase: Held in 1201 (Emperor Gotoba)

sen.j: 水無瀬恋十五首歌合 ： 建仁2年（1202年）＜後鳥羽院＞
sen.e: Minase Koijugoshu Uta-awase: held in 1202 <Gotoba in>
Minase Koijugoshu Uta-awase: Held in 1202 (Retired Emperor Gotoba)
